intro: Lagerstroemia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascan crepe myrtle, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red bracts that appear in late summer and persist through autumn. The plant has smooth, mottled bark that becomes flaky with age, and its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. The species is part of the Lythraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
